https://www.thetimes.com/life-style/prop.title: Move to Stroud, Gloucestershire
https://www.thetimes.com/life-style/prop.subtitle: House prices, schools and best streets to buy if you’re looking for a part-time commute — in the birthplace of Extinction Rebellion
https://www.thetimes.com/life-style/prop.text: Flight from the city isn’t just about the wide-eyed pursuit of birdsong and breathable air. The urban escapees setting their sights on Stroud are every bit as focused on the traditional fundamentals of good schools and transport links as they are on its unrivalled sense of community and the lush Cotswold countryside all around.\nThere are certainly plenty of them. Gemma Goulding, manager of the local branch of Hamptons International estate agency, saw an 80 per cent increase in would-be buyers over the summer compared with last year. Although more than half are from London, plenty are coming from Bristol too. “So many people just don’t seem to want to live in a city any more,” she says.\nNot that they’ll be cutting themselves off.
image: Fennells Home Farm near Stroud is on the market for £1.35 million with Strutt & Parker
